excerpt: Vast garden-filled grounds with dramatic, castle-style buildings showcasing historical & art pieces.
detail_description: Instituto Ricardo Brennand is a cultural institution located in Recife, Pernambuco, Brazil. It was established in 2002 by Ricardo de Almeida Coimbra Brennand and is housed within the medieval-style Forte de Sao Joao Batista do Brum. The institute features a military and weaponry museum, an art gallery, extensive parkland with outdoor sculptures, gardens, and a well-stocked library.
name: Instituto Ricardo Brennand
address: R. Mário Campelo, 700 - Várzea, Recife - PE, 50741-904, Brazil

excerpt: Olinda is a colonial town on Brazil’s northeast coast, near the city of Recife. Founded in 1535 by the Portuguese, it’s built on steep hillsides and distinguished by its 18th-century architecture, baroque churches, convents, monasteries and brightly painted houses. Originally a center for the sugarcane industry, it’s now known as an artists’ colony, with many galleries, workshops and museums.
detail_description: Olinda, a charming colonial town located on Brazil's northeast coast near Recife, was established in 1535 by the Portuguese. The town is characterized by its hilly terrain and well-preserved 18th-century architecture, including baroque churches, convents, monasteries, and vibrantly colored houses. Once a hub for the sugarcane industry, Olinda has transformed into an artists' colony with numerous galleries, workshops, and museums.
name: Olinda
address: State of Pernambuco, Brazil

detail_description: Casa da Cultura de Pernambuco is a vibrant cultural center in Recife, offering local crafts, cultural performances, and a rich historical experience. The building was originally a prison but has been transformed into a hub of art and culture with 150 craft shops. Visitors can explore the three cell galleries interconnected by steep staircases, each housing diverse cultural offerings.
name: Casa da Cultura de Pernambuco
address: R.Floriano Peixoto - São José, Recife - PE, 50020-060, Brazil

detail_description: Nestled in the heart of Recife, the Capela Dourada, or Golden Chapel, is a stunning testament to Baroque architecture and religious devotion. Established on May 13, 1696, by Captain General Caetano de Melo Castro and constructed under the skilled hands of master mason Antonio Fernandes de Matos, this chapel was completed remarkably quickly. By September 15, 1697—just sixteen months later—it opened its doors to worshippers with great ceremony.
name: Capela Dourada
address: Altura da rua Siqueira Campos, R. do Imperador Pedro II, S/N - Santo Antônio, Recife - PE, 50010-240, Brazil

excerpt: Recife Antigo is the historical section of central Recife, Brazil. It is located on the Island of Recife, near the Recife harbor. This historic area has been recently recovered and now holds several clubs, bars and a high-tech center called Porto Digital. Wikipedia.
detail_description: Recife, Brazil is home to Recife Antigo, the historic section of central Recife located on the Island of Recife near the harbor. Recently restored, it now features various clubs, bars, and a high-tech center called Porto Digital. Visitors can explore this area's rich history while enjoying its vibrant nightlife scene.
name: Recife
address: State of Pernambuco, 50030-230, Brazil

excerpt: Lively 7-mile stretch of sandy beach, with swimming only in areas protected by natural reefs.
detail_description: Boa Viagem Beach is a vibrant 7-mile stretch of sandy coastline in Recife, Brazil. The beach offers swimming areas protected by natural reefs, making it safe and enjoyable for visitors. A popular stop on tours combining Recife and Olinda, the beachfront at Boa Viagem is particularly lively on Sundays when locals flock to the shore. The area is known for its dense concentration of parasols and towering high-rise buildings that provide shade as the day progresses.
name: Boa Viagem Beach
address: Boa Viagem, Recife - State of Pernambuco, Brazil

excerpt: Recife is the state capital of Pernambuco, Brazil, on the northeastern Atlantic coast of South America. It is the largest urban area within both the North and the Northeast Region of Brazil. Wikipedia.
detail_description: Recife is a vibrant city with friendly locals and stunning beaches. It's home to the Taberna Japonesa Quina do Futuro, where chef Andre Saburo Matsumoto grew up and eventually took over the kitchen. The city offers the perfect blend of urban energy and beach relaxation, making it an ideal destination for travelers seeking both excitement and tranquility.
name: Recife
address: State of Pernambuco, Brazil

excerpt: Venue featuring classes, multimedia & rotating exhibitions dedicated to local dance & frevo music.
detail_description: Paço do Frevo is a vibrant venue that offers classes, multimedia presentations, and rotating exhibitions dedicated to the local dance and frevo music. Recently renovated, it is also home to several fascinating historic and cultural sites such as the Kahal Zur Israel Synagogue, the Franciscan Museum of Sacred Art, Cais do Sertao museum, and Centro de Artesanato de Pernambuco.
name: Paço do Frevo
address: Praça do Arsenal da Marinha, s.n - Recife, PE, 50030-360, Brazil

excerpt: Upscale Boa Viagem is known for its long namesake beach, flanked by a boardwalk and lively Shopping Recife mall. Protected by reefs, the warm, shallow waters attract families. Dining options include street-food snacks like sweet or savory tapioca crêpes, pay-per-weight buffets, and seafood restaurants with ocean views. Beachfront bars and nightclubs provide a party vibe after dark, when the beach is illuminated.
detail_description: Boa Viagem is a popular upscale destination known for its expansive beach, vibrant boardwalk, and bustling Shopping Recife mall. Families are drawn to the warm, shallow waters protected by reefs. The area offers diverse dining options ranging from street-food snacks to seafood restaurants with ocean views. After dark, beachfront bars and nightclubs provide a lively atmosphere.
name: Boa Viagem
address: Recife - State of Pernambuco, Brazil

excerpt: Modern museum celebrating the music of singer-composer Luiz Gonzaga & Northeastern Brazil's culture.
detail_description: Centro Cultural Cais do Sertão is a modern museum located in Recife Antigo, serving as a celebration of the music of singer-composer Luiz Gonzaga and the culture of Northeastern Brazil. The museum, which was once old port warehouses, pays tribute to the stories of the Brazilian people. It offers an interactive experience about the Sertao and Luiz Gonzaga, making it one of the most beautiful cultural centers in South America.
name: Centro Cultural Cais do Sertão
address: Armazen 10, Av. Alfredo Lisboa, s/n - Recife, PE, 50030-150, Brazil

excerpt: Museum & workshop of a famous Brazilian plastic artist, with ceramics, sculptures & paintings.
detail_description: Oficina Ceramica Francisco Brennand is a museum and workshop dedicated to the renowned Brazilian plastic artist, Francisco Brennand. The site was originally an old family pottery that the artist transformed into a temple of art, showcasing his own works since 1971. Visitors can explore nearly 2,000 pieces including ceramics, sculptures, and paintings primarily centered around themes like sexuality.
name: Oficina Ceramica Francisco Brennand
address: Propriedade Santos Cosme e Damião, R. Diogo de Vasconcelos, S/N - Várzea, Recife - PE, 50740-970, Brazil

detail_description: Embark on a leisurely stroll through the historic Praca da Republica, then continue your exploration to the grand Teatro Santa Isabel. Afterward, make your way to the Catedral de Sao Pedro dos Clerigos, also known as Recife Co-Cathedral. Don't miss the vibrant Mercado do Sao Jose for an array of local arts and crafts, including a dedicated section for intricate lacework.
name: Praça da República - Santo Antônio
address: Recife - PE, 50010-040, Brazil

excerpt: Bustling covered market with street food stalls & vendors selling tropical fruit, clothing & crafts.
detail_description: Nestled in the heart of Recife, the Mercado de São José stands as a vibrant testament to local culture and history. This bustling covered market is Brazil's oldest, dating back to 1875, showcasing a stunning neoclassical design with its iconic cast-iron structure. Visitors can wander through an array of stalls offering everything from tropical fruits and fresh produce to unique artisanal crafts like woven baskets and clay sculptures.
name: Mercado de São José - Recife
address: Praça Dom Vital - São José, Recife - PE, 50020-280, Brazil

excerpt: Huge, urban shopping mall with international brands & luxury boutiques, plus cinemas & a food court.
detail_description: The RioMar Recife Mall is a large and popular shopping center located in the heart of the city of Recife, Brazil. It features a wide variety of stores, including luxury brands like Diesel, Prada, Burberry, Coach, Dolce & Gabbana, Emporio Armani, and Calvin Klein alongside some major Brazilian brands. The mall is well-maintained and beautiful to visit with many recreational activities available for shoppers and tourists alike.
name: RioMar Recife
address: Av. República do Líbano, 251 - Pina, Recife - PE, 51110-160, Brazil

excerpt: Picturesque area in front of an 18th-century chapel surrounded by pastel-colored colonial houses.
detail_description: Pátio de São Pedro is a charming area in front of an 18th-century chapel, surrounded by colonial houses painted in bright colors. This spacious pedestrian square is famous for its beautiful architecture and serves as the central point for Recife's vibrant annual carnival celebrations. The nearby Praca da Republica offers a more serene atmosphere with its 19th-century buildings and landscaped park.
name: Pátio de São Pedro
address: R. São Pedro, 31 - São José, Recife - PE, 50020-210, Brazil

excerpt: Recife, the capital of Brazil’s northeastern state of Pernambuco, is distinguished by its many rivers, bridges, islets and peninsulas. Recife Antigo, on its own island by the harbor, is the historic old town center dating to the 16th century. To its south, popular Boa Viagem Beach is sheltered by reefs and lined by tall apartment blocks, modern hotels and restaurants.
detail_description: Recife, the capital of Brazil's northeastern state of Pernambuco, is a city known for its intricate network of rivers, bridges, and islands. The historic old town center, Recife Antigo, dates back to the 16th century and is situated on its own island by the harbor. Boa Viagem Beach to the south offers a picturesque setting with reefs and high-rise buildings along the shore.
name: Recife
address: State of Pernambuco, Brazil

detail_description: Santa Isabel Theater, a Neoclassical architectural gem in Pernambuco, is a significant monument listed as National Historical and Artistic Heritage. It was built during a transformative period for Recife, reflecting the city's evolution from colonial times. Visitors can enjoy guided tours of the theater, exploring its rooms and stage while experiencing the ambiance of traditional theatrical performances. The elegant venue also hosts various events, offering an unforgettable experience for tourists and locals alike.
name: Santa Isabel Theater
address: Praça da República - Santo Antônio, Recife - PE, 50010-040, Brazil

detail_description: Located in a stunning historical neo-classical building near Ground Zero, Caixa Cultural offers art galleries on two floors, a theatre, and a multimedia room. The branch aims to promote arts, crafts, and local culture with free access for everyone. Visitors can enjoy exhibitions and cultural shows suitable for the whole family. Additionally, the venue is wheelchair accessible. The Recife branch is housed in another well-preserved ancient architecture with a great view inside and an impressive glass floor on one of its levels.
name: Caixa Cultural
address: Av. Alfredo Lisboa, 505 - Recife, PE, 50030-150, Brazil

detail_description: The Synagogue Kahal Zur Israel, located in Recife, is a historic and cultural site that has been recently renovated. It is the oldest synagogue in the Americas, dating back to 1636. For the past 15 years, it has functioned as a museum showcasing the rich history of the Jewish community in Pernambuco. Visitors can also explore other nearby attractions such as the Franciscan Museum of Sacred Art and Cais do Sertao, which focuses on rural culture.
name: Synagogue Kahal Zur Israel
address: R. do Bom Jesus, 197 - Recife, PE, 50030-170, Brazil

excerpt: Expansive complex of local & global shops, plus counter-serve eateries, cafes & a game arcade.
detail_description: Shopping Recife is a vibrant and expansive shopping destination that has been delighting visitors for over 30 years. With more than 400 stores, it offers a mix of local and international brands, making it the perfect place to indulge in some retail therapy. The mall also boasts an impressive array of entertainment options, including a multiplex cinema, bowling alley, and various food courts that cater to every palate.
name: Shopping Recife
address: R. Padre Carapuceiro, 777 - Boa Viagem, Recife - PE, 51020-900, Brazil

name: Catamaran Tours - Passeios em Pernambuco
address: Cais Santa Rita, s/n - São José, Recife - PE, 50020-360, Brazil

excerpt: Open plaza featuring a colorfully painted floor & hosting cultural events & musical concerts.
detail_description: Marco Zero Square is a notable historical landmark in Recife, Brazil that showcases the city's rich history. The plaza features a vibrantly painted floor and regularly hosts cultural events and musical concerts. Aside from its cultural significance, the square also serves as a starting point for measuring distances in the city. Visitors can take a stroll along the nearby beaches while immersing themselves in Recife's colorful and tranquil atmosphere. Despite its popularity among tourists, Marco Zero Square remains well-guarded for security purposes.
name: Praça do Marco Zero
address: Av. Alfredo Lisboa - Recife, PE, 50030-150, Brazil

excerpt: Modern galleries built in 1979 displaying Brazilian artifacts, artwork & cultural records.
detail_description: The Museu do Homem do Nordeste is a museum in Recife, Brazil that houses a large collection of artifacts, art, and cultural records from throughout Brazilian history.
name: Museu do Homem do Nordeste
address: Av. Dezessete de Agosto, 2187 - Casa Forte, Recife - PE, 52061-540, Brazil

excerpt: 19th-century observatory tower with regular astronomy sessions & diverse cultural exhibits.
detail_description: Malakoff Tower, a 19th-century observatory and gateway to Arsenal da Marinha square, is a historical landmark in Recife. Named after a similar monument in the Crimean peninsula, it was initially part of the Marine base territory but later transformed into a cultural hub. The tower offers regular astronomy sessions and diverse cultural exhibits, making it one of the best places to visit in the Old Town.
name: Malakoff Tower
address: Praça do Arsenal, s/n - Recife, PE, 50030-350, Brazil

detail_description: Convento de São Francisco do Carmo Olinda is a must-visit attraction in the vibrant city of Recife, known for its rich cultural heritage and lively festivals. The city showcases the talents of renowned artists like Romero Britto, Francisco Brennand, and Nelson Rodrigues. Visitors can immerse themselves in the cheerful rhythms of frevo and maracatu while experiencing the exuberant Carnival celebrations, including the famous Galo da Madrugada.
name: Convento de São Francisco do Carmo Olinda
address: Rua do imperador Pedro ll, 307, Sala 101 - Santo Antônio, Recife - PE, 50010-360, Brazil

detail_description: Lojinha do Mosteiro de São Bento de Olinda is a must-visit when exploring Olinda. The monastery boasts an impressive 14-meter high, 12-ton Baroque altar, showcased as a masterpiece at the Guggenheim Museum in New York. The monastery choir is renowned as one of Brazil's best, offering mesmerizing Gregorian chants during Sunday masses. Visitors can also experience excellent service and have their objects blessed upon request.
name: Lojinha do Mosteiro de São Bento de Olinda
address: Varadouro, Olinda - PE, 53010-240, Brazil

detail_description: Irmandade de São Pedro dos Clérigos is a stunning church located in Praca do Carmo. The church, built in 1580, boasts impressive frescoes that have been partially restored. It overlooks the charming square and adds to the beauty of the area.
name: Irmandade de São Pedro dos Clérigos
address: Pátio São Pedro - s/n, PE, 50020-220, Brazil

excerpt: Recreational park offering jogging/biking paths, picnic tables, a chapel, skating rink & playground.
detail_description: Jaqueira Park is a large, green space in Recife that is perfect for enjoying a jog or bike ride, playing on the playground, or taking a peaceful picnic lunch. The park has plenty of benches and shady spots for resting and offers easy access for people with disabilities.
name: Parque da Jaqueira
address: Av. Rui Barbosa, S/N - Graças, Recife - PE, 50050-290, Brazil

excerpt: Local history museum in a grand 1800s building featuring paintings, sculptures & other artifacts.
detail_description: The Pernambuco State Museum has a vast and varied collection of art from across Brazil, indigenous cultures, and the Netherlands. It's also home to Salao de Arte Contemporanea de Pernambuco, which showcases the work of up-and-coming artists in the region.
name: Pernambuco State Museum
address: Av. Rui Barbosa, 960 - Graças, Recife - PE, 52050-000, Brazil

excerpt: Environmental education center with themed gardens, guided walking trails & ecological exhibits.
detail_description: The Botanical Garden of Recife is a park with many different types of plants. It's free to enter and has information about the plants and their uses available. The forest inside the garden is also very nice on a hot day.
name: Botanical Garden of Recife
address: Rodovia BR 232, s/n, Curado, Recife - PE, Brazil

excerpt: Family-friendly theme park with a variety of roller coasters, spinning rides & kids' attractions.
detail_description: Nestled in the vibrant city of Recife, Mirabilandia is a family-friendly amusement park that promises an unforgettable day filled with excitement and adventure. Since its opening in 2001, this unique destination has become a favorite for locals and tourists alike, thanks to its impressive array of 35 rides and attractions catering to all ages. From thrilling roller coasters that will get your heart racing to gentle spinning rides perfect for younger visitors, there's something for everyone at Mirabilandia.
name: Mirabilandia
address: Av. Prof. Andrade Bezerra, 1285 - Salgadinho, Olinda - PE, 53110-110, Brazil

detail_description: The Central Station Museum in Capiba offers a unique insight into the history of Recife and the surrounding area. The museum has a collection of artifacts from all over Brazil, as well as photos, documents and memorabilia from the city's past. There are also displays on transportation in Recife and around Brazil, making it an excellent place to learn about local culture.
name: Central Station Capiba / Recife Train Museum
address: R.Floriano Peixoto, s/n - São José, Recife - PE, 50020-060, Brazil

detail_description: Forte de São João Batista do Brum, also known as Fort De Bruyn, is a historic fort located in Recife, Brazil. Built in the 16th century by Portuguese conquerors to protect the city from foreign invasion, it later fell under Dutch control during the invasion of Pernambuco. Today, it stands as a popular tourist destination and houses a military museum exhibiting weapons, cannons, and photos from the time of Dutch occupation.
name: Forte de São João Batista do Brum
address: Praça da Comunidade Luso Brasileira - Recife, PE, 50030-270, Brazil

excerpt: Wide, white sandy beach lined by reef & lapped by clear waters, close to hotels & restaurants.
detail_description: Pina Beach, also known as Coroa do Aviao Beach, is a stunning destination along the Recife coast. Accessible by boat, this island beach boasts white sands and warm waters, offering a serene escape with plenty of birdlife and coastal vegetation to admire. Visitors can enjoy activities like running, cycling, and even bring their dogs for a leisurely stroll. The beach provides a perfect setting for gatherings with friends or family, featuring amenities such as a skate park and playgrounds for kids.
name: Praia do Pina em Recife
address: Av. Boa Viagem - Pina, Recife - PE, 51011-000, Brazil

excerpt: Park offering play areas & a skating rink, plus a theater & an art gallery, with scenic ocean views.
detail_description: Parque Dona Lindu, a stunning urban oasis in Recife, Brazil, is a must-visit for anyone seeking a blend of culture and natural beauty. Nestled along the picturesque Boa Viagem Beach, this park showcases the innovative architectural style of Oscar Niemeyer. Visitors can enjoy various activities including play areas for children and a skating rink that adds to its family-friendly atmosphere.
name: Parque Dona Lindu
address: Av. Boa Viagem, s/n - Boa Viagem, Recife - PE, 51030-010, Brazil

detail_description: The Memorial Luiz Gonzaga is a vibrant tribute to one of Brazil's most influential musicians, who played a pivotal role in shaping the country's musical landscape. Since its inception, this cultural landmark has celebrated the rich rhythms and sounds of Northeastern Brazil, showcasing genres like xote, xamego, and xaxado that resonate deeply with local identity. The memorial not only honors Luiz Gonzaga's legacy but also serves as a reminder of how he brought the essence of regional music to national prominence.
name: Memorial Luiz Gonzaga
address: R. São Pedro, 35 - São José, Recife - PE, 50020-220, Brazil

detail_description: Praça do Arsenal is a charming square located in the historic neighborhood of Recife Antigo. The area is known for its picturesque architecture, including the magnificent church of Madre de Deus and the Portuguese Obelisk. Visitors can also explore the nearby street Do Bom Jesus, which offers a glimpse into the city's rich history. To fully appreciate the area, consider joining an organized tour accompanied by a guide to learn about the city's history and enrich your experience.
name: Praça do Arsenal
address: Recife, PE, 50030-360, Brazil

excerpt: This 3-room memorial explores the life & interests of singer & composer Chico Science.
detail_description: Nestled in the quaint São Pedro courtyard, the Memorial Chico Science is a hidden gem dedicated to celebrating the life and legacy of the iconic singer and composer. This small yet intriguing memorial features three distinct rooms that offer visitors a glimpse into Chico's world. The first room showcases a timeline highlighting significant milestones in his life, while the second serves as an audiovisual space where you can immerse yourself in documentaries about this influential figure.
name: Memorial Chico Science
address: R. São Pedro, 21 - São José, Recife - PE, 50020-570, Brazil

detail_description: Nestled in a historic building dating back to the mid-1800s, the Mamam - Museum of Modern Art Aloísio Magalhães is a cultural gem in Recife. Originally serving as the headquarters for the Recife International Club and later as City Hall until the 1960s, this space was transformed into an art venue in 1981.
name: Mamam - Museum of Modern Art Aloísio Magalhães
address: R. da Aurora, 265 - Boa Vista, Recife - PE, 50060-010, Brazil

detail_description: The Museu Regional de Olinda is a must-visit for those interested in delving into the city's colonial past. Housed in a 16th-century residence, this museum offers a glimpse into the social and domestic life of Olinda's inhabitants in the 1700s. Originally serving as an episcopal residence, it was transformed into a museum to commemorate the 4th centenary of Duarte Coelho's arrival to Pernambuco.
name: Museu Regional de Olinda
address: R. do Amparo, 128 - Amparo, Olinda - PE, 53020-190, Brazil

excerpt: Popular for its off-road biking trails, this wooded park rises to viewpoints over the city & sea.
detail_description: The National Historical Park of Guararapes is a popular destination known for its scenic off-road biking trails that wind through the wooded park, offering stunning viewpoints overlooking the city and sea. The park also hosts the annual traditional festival of Nossa Senhora dos Prazeres, locally referred to as Festa da Pitomba, after the region's native fruit. This celebration takes place from March 16th to March 24th in the park's courtyard.
name: National Historical Park of Guararapes
address: Ladeira Montes dos Guararapes, Jaboatão dos Guararapes - PE, Brazil

excerpt: Haborside park on a reef featuring unique works by the famous Brazilian sculptor Francisco Brennand.
detail_description: Parque de Esculturas Francisco Brennand is a stunning harborside park located in the Boa Viagem neighborhood of Recife. It serves as an open-air art gallery, showcasing the unique works of the renowned Brazilian sculptor Francisco Brennand. The park offers breathtaking views of the city and is celebrated for its beautiful landscape. Accessible by boat from Marco Zero or by car via Avda.
name: Parque de Esculturas Francisco Brennand
address: Av. Brasília Formosa - Brasília Teimosa, Recife - PE, 51010-145, Brazil

excerpt: A renovated 35,000-capacity sports stadium, home of Sporting Club do Recife & 1950 World Cup venue.
detail_description: Estádio Adelmar da Costa Carvalho is a recently renovated sports arena with a seating capacity of 35,000. It serves as the home ground for Sporting Club do Recife and was also a venue for the 1950 World Cup. The stadium holds significant historical value and is known for its vibrant atmosphere, drawing passionate fans who bring good energy to the matches.
name: Estádio Adelmar da Costa Carvalho
address: Rua Sport Club do Recife - Ilha do Retiro, Recife - PE, 50750-560, Brazil

excerpt: Expansive forest reserve with a long-running zoo, natural science museum & trails.
detail_description: The state park Parque Dois Irmãos is located in the city of Duque de Caxias, in the State of Rio de Janeiro. The park was established in 1908 and has a total area of 956 acres. It contains a Zoo Botanical Park with more than 600 animals from the Brazilian fauna, as well as a Natural Science Museum and an Atlantic Forest reserve.
name: Parque Estadual Dois Irmãos
address: Praça Farias Neves, s/n - Dois Irmãos, Recife - PE, 52171-011, Brazil

detail_description: Palácio do Campo das Princesas, located in Recife, is a place steeped in history and architectural beauty. Visitors can explore the stunning architecture, art pieces, and various rooms while being guided through the palace. The surrounding neighborhoods offer additional attractions such as churches like Basilica de Nossa Senhora do Carmo, the lively Sao Jose market, and Casa da Cultura.
name: Palácio do Campo das Princesas
address: Praça da República, S/N - Santo Antônio, Recife - PE, 50010-928, Brazil

detail_description: The archaeological museum Forte Orange, also known as Fortaleza de Santa Cruz de Itamaracá, is a captivating destination offering splendid panoramic vistas. Visitors can explore the area quickly within 30 minutes while enjoying breathtaking views of the ocean. Nearby, there are an abundance of dining options and charming beach spots to relax at. The fort itself has a fascinating history; originally constructed by the Portuguese and later rebuilt after being destroyed by the Dutch.
name: Forte Orange - Fortaleza de Santa Cruz de Itamaracá
address: Acesso ao Forte Orange, s/nº, Ac. ao Forte Orange, Ilha de Itamaracá - PE, Brazil

excerpt: Venue featuring classes, multimedia & rotating exhibitions dedicated to local dance & frevo music.
name: Paço do Frevo
address: Praça do Arsenal da Marinha, s.n - Recife, PE, 50030-360, Brazil

detail_description: The Gilberto Freyre Foundation Museum is located in a luxurious area of Recife, Brazil and is dedicated to the memory of Gilberto Freyre, sociologist and writer. The museum has a rich collection of books, paintings, sculptures, and personal belongings belonging to the sociologist. It was restored to its original 19th century style.
name: Gilberto Freyre Foundation
address: Rua Jorge Tasso Neto, s/n Primeiro Portão, Apipucos, Recife - PE, 52071-440, Brazil

excerpt: 17th-century basilica with a black & white facade, plus richly gilded altarpieces & side chapels.
detail_description: Basilica of Our Lady of Mount Carmel is a 17th-century architectural marvel with a striking black and white facade, adorned with opulent gilded altarpieces and side chapels. The basilica's history dates back to the institutional reform in the Carmelite order, known as the Touraine reform. It was built on the site of an old palace after consensus was reached to establish a church dedicated to Lady of Desterro.
name: Basilica of Our Lady of Mount Carmel
address: Av. Dantas Barreto, 646 - Santo Antônio, Recife - PE, 50020-000, Brazil

detail_description: Arquivo Histórico Judaico de Pernambuco is a significant site, being the first synagogue in Brazilian territory and the Americas. It holds an emblematic place in history and offers a captivating collection of documents and architecture that narrate the Jewish trajectory. The location marks the beginning of the entry of people who embrace God's promise into their lives.
name: Arquivo Histórico Judaico de Pernambuco
address: R. do Bom Jesus, 197 - Recife, PE, 50030-170, Brazil
